PULL THROUGH A DOUBLE-GLASS MIRROR INTO
DISSOLVE THROUGH THE WHITES OF THE EYES TO
SLOW MOTION, TERRIBLE, NIGHTMARISH, EXPRESSIONISTIC IMAGE
I/E. GATSBY'S CAR/THE VALLEY OF ASHES
THROUGH THE WATER HEADLINES FADE IN
AN ARRAY OF MEMORIES AND IMAGES DISSOLVE ONE INTO THE OTH
IMAGES OF DECADENT NEW YORK FADE IN, ILLUSTRATING NICK'S
THE CAMERA PUSHES SLOWLY DOWN TOWARD GATSBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continue drifting, through the snow, across an icy lake..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back then all of us drank too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: A stately Victorian building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The more in tune with the times we were, the more we drank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The sign, "The Perkins Sanitarium."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And none of us contributed anything new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: A man shrouded in darkness. He leans against an fireplace, hand covering his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I came back from New York I was disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: NICK CARRAWAY (37), unshaven, morbidly alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusted... with everyone, and everything... Only one man was exempt from my disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: A kind, elderly DOCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One man...? Mr. Carraway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he a friend of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was... the single most hopeful person I have ever met... And am ever likely to meet again. There was something about him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick wanders slowly towards the window, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sensitivity. He was like one of those machines that register earthquakes ten thousand miles away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you meet him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stops and stares out the window, haunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a party. In New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE CLOUDS: New skyscrapers pierce a clear blue s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the summer of 1922, the tempo of the city approached hysteria...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON WALL STREET: A fever pitch of buying and selling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stocks hit record peaks. And Wall Street boomed, in a steady golden roar...

dialogues.speaker: IMAGES OF DECADENT NEW YORK FADE IN, ILLUSTRATING NICK'S
dialogues.text: Dancing girls, speakeasies, bootleg kings, fat cats count fresh fortunes, and the stock market climbing up, up, up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parties were bigger; the shows were broader; the buildings were higher; the morals were looser; and the ban on alcohol had backfired... making the liquor cheaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE IN: A sea of boater hats crowds a Manhattan street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wall Street was luring the young and ambitious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH TOWARD: One of the hats. Its wearer stops, and gazes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: A clear-eyed, hopeful, 29 year old Nick Carraway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL: The city is still visible in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rented a house twenty miles from the city, on Long Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: A unkempt bungalow, hemmed in by enormous mansi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lived at West Egg...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is moving in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in a forgotten grounds-keeper's cottage squeezed among the mansions of the newly rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is unpacking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get started, I bought a dozen volumes on credit, banking and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A row of heavy red and gold-bound bonds books. plucks one up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All new to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And turns on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stock market hit another record high today!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Countless identical grey-suited CLERKS, yell into telepho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like pickin' up money in the street!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a dandy tip on Burlington; who's comin with me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: Nick, speaking much more moderately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, of course nothing is one hundred percent. Well, I wouldn't go investing every penny. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, still unpacking, eyes a mountain of unpacked books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Yale, I'd dreamed of being a writer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He resists the temptation to swap bonds books for literat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I gave all that up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick emerges onto the porch, greeted by dazzling sunshine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the sun shining and the great bursts of leaves on the trees, I planned to spend the summer studying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits and places his bonds book in front of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I probably would have--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When woman's shriek startles him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK'S POV: On the neighboring beach a group of revellers frolicking. A scantily girl clad waves and then disappear into the trees, drawing Nick's eye to his neighbor's hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were it not for the riotous amusements that beckoned from beyond the walls of that colossal castle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through dense foliage Nick spies the mysterious spires an towers of the neighboring Gothic folly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owned by a gentleman I had not yet met, named...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a high tower window, a curtain flutters ominously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick, still staring out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor concludes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... He was your neighbor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My neighbor? No, Gatsby was-- Well-- If I think about it... The history of the summer really began the night I drove over to my cousin Daisy's for dinner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH AND WIDE: Nick's old Dodge disappears down the drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lived across the bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An impressive Georgian mansion overlooks a quarter mile o lawn that cascades down to a private polo field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In old money East Egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRINNNGGG! BRINNNGGG! We hear a phone ringing off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW: A polo player (TOM), as he gallops toward the hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her husband was heir to one of America's wealthiest families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom whacks the polo ball...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name was Tom Buchanan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball nearly hits one of Tom's gardeners...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we were at Yale together he'd been a sporting star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom dismounts and bounds up the stairs to the porch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now his glory days were behind him and he contented himself with... other affairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom aggressively grabs the telephone from HENRI, the butl and turns; revealing an imposing, hard-mouthed man of thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I told you not to call me here...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL FOCUS: Tom sees a servant escort Nick along the balc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clunking down the receiver, Tom strides toward Nick and grasps his hand with overbearing strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shakespeare! How's the great American novel coming...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm selling bonds now Tom... with Walter Chase's outfit--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom slaps Nick with irritating heartiness!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What say after dinner we go into town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch up with the old wolf pack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big day on the new job tomorrow--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense! We're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom leads Nick down a grand hall lined with the trophies chronicle Tom's infinite sporting achievements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First team, all-American!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom admires his own achievements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? Made me who I am today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom pulls his favorite trophy from the cabinet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here-- Forest Hills... I played the Prince of Wales. What a sissy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom exchanges the trophy for a football.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life's something you dominate Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pelts Nick with the ball--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're any good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick fumbles as Tom charges him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha-ha-ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom tackles Nick, knocking him back, through a pair of vaulting doors, and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shimmering, sun-dazzled room in which enormous white curtains whip and snap in the breeze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick, frozen, awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the giggle of naughty children...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!!! As the French doors shut, and the curtains fall, beautiful white hand rises from behind the couch, and wit it, a low, thrilling voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Nicky... Is that you my lovely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, 23 year old DAISY BUCHANAN, appears from over t back of the couch. Her bright eyes and passionate mouth a framed by a strawberry-blonde bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Daisy, captivating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy Buchanan. The golden girl. A breathless warmth flowed from her. A promise that there was no one else in the world she so wanted to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whispers dramatically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they miss me in Chicago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. About a dozen people send their love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're absolutely in mourning... They're crying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're wailing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're screaming, they're shouting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Daisy Buchanan, we can't live without you!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm p-paralyzed with happiness...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy takes Nick's hand and squeals with childish glee as drags him over the sofa and onto his back on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares up... And, a mysterious, athletic girl glares b This is 22 year old, JORDAN BAKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan Baker; a very famous golfer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick, the blood drains from his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was the most frightening person I'd ever seen--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick rights himself and extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen your face on the cover of "Sporting Life". Nick Carraway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jordan merely yawns and stands (we get a good look).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I enjoyed looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been lying on that sofa for as long as I can remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy turns to Nick with scandalous delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! This summer I'll sort of, fling you and Jordan together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tom prepares drinks at the bar, he glances skittishly white telephone set ostentatiously upon a marble pedestal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll push you into linen closets, and out to sea in boats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not listening to a word!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irritated, Tom turns to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Daisy tells me you're over at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: throwing your lot in with those social-climbing, primitive New Money types...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, my little shack is cardboard box at eighty a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your life is adorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan toys with a golf club, and speaks with bored conte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know somebody in West Egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know a single--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan turns dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you must know Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, a sharp intake of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Daisy, as she struggles to control rising emoti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Gatsby...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before anyone can reply, Henri announces--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame, le diner est servi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jordan WHACKS a golf ball into a makeshift cup - a tro on the floor - waiters sweep open the doors and the curta flutter up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, Nick, Jordan and Tom sit at a long, sumptuously la table. Food, wine, laughter, smoking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVING ABSTRACTLY: Through fragments of conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to hear a family secret? Its about the butler's nose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things went from bad to worse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky... I heard a rumor, that you were getting married to a girl out west...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its a libel, I'm too poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have to be old so they die quickly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we talk about something else? Anything? Crops? You're making me feel uncivilized Daisy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This draws a strangely violent interjection from Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Civilization's going to pieces! Have you read 'The Rise of the Colored Empires' by this fellow Goddard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stands and begins to pace--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone ought to read it. The idea is that its up to us, the dominant race, to watch out, or these other races...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom straightens the bow-tie on his black servant--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will have control of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's been very profound lately. He reads deep books with long words in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been proved. Its scientific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtly mocking Tom) We've got to beat them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY, BRINNNGGG! The telephone. All freeze. Another r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An embarrassed moment; suddenly Daisy throws her napkin d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows Tom into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, at a loss, turns to Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this Mr. Gatsby you spoke of is my neighbor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh... Don't talk. I want to hear what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A subdued, impassioned murmur is audible in the room beyo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought everybody knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's got some woman in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got some woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She might have the decency not to telephone at dinner-time... Don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost before Nick has grasped her meaning, the doors ban open and Tom and Daisy return to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a tense gayety) I just love seeing you at my table Nicky. You remind me of a rose, an absolute rose... Doesn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even faintly like a rose--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... After dinner Nick wanted to go into town. Right Nick? To the Yale club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky, stay--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to work early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense. Its only for a drink or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy and Tom stare at Nick - both demanding his allegian

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY! The telephone rings again: BRINNNGGG! Again, al freeze. BRINNNGGG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN: On Daisy as the telephone continues to shriek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of us could ignore that fifth guest's shrill metallic urgency...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Servants clear. Jordan and Tom retire to the salon, as Ni and Daisy stroll down toward the water, and Daisy confide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Nicky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its just, well, you see, I think everything's terrible anyhow. You know I've been everywhere and seen everything and done everything, and I've had very bad time Nicky... I'm pretty cyncical about everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy gazes melancholic across the bay; an awkward silenc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick tries to change the subject--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter; I suppose she talks, and... eats, and everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pammy? Oh yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy leans on a stone balustrade and gazes down toward t dock, where a green light glows in the velvet dusk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Nick, when she was born, Tom was God knows where - with God knows whom - and I asked the nurse if it was a boy or a girl. She told me it was a girl, and I wept. 'All right,' I said, 'I'm glad it's a girl. And I hope she'll be a fool - that's the best thing a girl can be in this world, a beautiful little fool.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks off, and looks at Nick with that smile of hers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the bright precious things fade so fast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as a sad, sweet underscore plays, WE PUSH out over th water, and across the bay toward Gatsby's castle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they don't come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE DISCOVER: At the end of Gatsby's dock, A MAN - his dar silhouette is cut against the paler black of the night sk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance behind him we see headlights. It is Nick, pulling up at his bungalow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gets out of his car. He stops. Through the trees, he see The Man gazing intently across the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I arrived home I noticed that a figure had emerged on my neighbor's dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick goes closer, and watches The Man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And something told me it was... Mr. Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man reaches out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seemed to be... reaching toward something out there in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A green light on dock pulses in the distant darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, troubled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The green light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick struggles with a painful memory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about this Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick breaks off; and after a VERY LONG SILENCE, he admits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk about THIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then write about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Write.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all, you said that writing brought you solace, once upon a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. It didn't bring anyone else much solace... I wasn't any good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor offers Nick a pen; but Nick does not accept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one need ever read it. You can always burn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would I write about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything. Whatever you can't quite talk about; a memory; a thought; a place... Write it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick considering the challenge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly he takes the pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the clatter of metal wheels on train tracks; AS T SCREEN FILLS WITH WORDS, we hear them as voice-over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Valley of Ashes was a grotesque place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH AND WIDE: A vast dumping ground comprised of massive mounds of smoldering ash; train tracks cut through its he and the gleaming towers of the city shimmer in the distan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York's dumping ground, half way between West Egg and the city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAGES illustrate the poverty and hopelessness of life he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Where the burnt out coal that powered the booming, golden city was discarded by men who moved dimly and already crumbling through the powdery air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A train waits at a drawbridge spanning a small, foul cree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: Nick, aboard the train, looking out at the awfu wasteland...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This fantastic farm was ever- watched by Dr. T. J. Eckleberg...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK'S POV: A gigantic paint peeling billboard reads: "Dr T.J. Eckleberg."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A forgotten oculist whose eyes brooded over it all like the eyes of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, flushed with booze and heat, glances covertly around halted carriage. Nick sits opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom had invited me to town, on the pretense of a lunch at the Yale Club....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the carriage moves, Tom suddenly pulls Nick to his fee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the day took an unexpected turn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom drags Nick from the moving train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the train pulls off, Nick, exasperates, chases Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second would you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominate Nick! Dominate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN TO DISCOVER: Tom and Nick outside a small garage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads: "GEORGE B. WILSON. Cars Bought and Sold."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tom and Nick enter the dim garage, WILSON, a nervous, spiritless man, appears from the back office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Wilson! How's business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't complain. When are you going to sell me that car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got my man working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Works pretty slow, don't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'd better sell it somewhere else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean that, I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson's grovelling is terminated by the sound of chunky heels corkscrewing down stairs from above. All turn to se MYRTLE WILSON. Buxom. Smoldering. Elementally sensual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If its business you're talking, you should be talking to me... (to her husband) Get some chairs why don't you; so somebody can sit down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myrtle smiles slowly and, walking through her husband as he were a ghost, shakes hands with Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure... Sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson hurries out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Wilson... Nick Carraway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pleasure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's a writer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myrtle is completely uninterested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in bonds, actually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intently to Myrtle) Get on the next train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing hard to get) Now...? Are we gettin' that dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want. And you can call up your sister... (glancing to Nick) She'll like him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, that's alright, I'm busy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine's said to be very good looking, by people who oughta know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Nick) Do you want to embarrass Myrtle...? That's rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The muffled sounds of sex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A puppy mouthing a soggy dog biscuit that disso into a saucer of milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, horrified, perches on a couch in a small room stuff with tacky, pretentious objects; obviously bought by Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick springs to his feet and yanks open the front door, o to be startled by a slender, louche girl in her twenties, with a sticky bob of red hair. This is CATHERINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sweeps into the room, pivots, and extends her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Catherine; ain't we havin' a party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm... I'm not sure now's a good time-- I was just going--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Nick's exit is blocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. MCKEE, a shrill woman in her 30s, enters with MR. MC a feminine man with a bit of shaving cream on his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending his hand) Chester McKee, pleasure to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick Carraway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're the kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is still trying to leave, but Catherine corners him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Don't ya like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY! The bedroom door whooshes open and Myrtle appea wearing an astounding, red jersey sheath dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myrtle Turtle...! Oh, that dress is adorable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with impressive hauteur) It's just a crazy old thing. I slip it on when I don't care what I look like!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom appears behind Myrtle, arrogantly buttoning his shirt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some ice Myrtle, before everyone goes to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myrtle sweeps into the kitchen; Tom opens the liquor cabi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making for the door) Tom, I really should be going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Nick's arm) Nonsense...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom; I don't think-- Daisy's my--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom pulls Nick back toward the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Nick, you like to watch; I remember that from college. And that's OK, I make no judgment; but we've got a whole summer - do you want to sit on the sideline and watch, or do you want to play ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ain't we good enough for ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine winks, pushes Nick into his chair, and fearless lands herself in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off yer hat and stay awhile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Nick! McKee's in the artistic game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's artistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, no, well, I write a little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom clunks the gramophone needle onto a record and Cather raises her voice above the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you live on Long Island, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live at West Egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I was there at a party about a month ago. At a man named Gatsby's. Do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live right next door to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a cousin of Kaiser Wilhelm's. You know, the evil German king...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: Tom raising Myrtle's skirt suggestively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey McKee, take a picture of that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not one of those models...! But you can if you want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine leans close and whispers in Nick's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither of them can stand who they're married to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't she like Wilson either?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He's a greasy little scumbag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom grins arrogantly and offers a drink to Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks; I feel just as good on nothing at all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a suggestive glimpse of tongue, Catherine pops a pil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nerve pills, I get them from a doctor in Queens. You want one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My nerves are fine thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine smiles mischievously, puts a pill on her tongue suddenly kisses Nick... He splutters, but Catherine tips scotch to his mouth, washing the pill down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had been drunk just twice in my life and the second time was that afternoon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE TO: Blurry freakish images of time passing... Th whiskey is in demand by all; Catherine dances a solo. The music is sexy, dirty, deafening. The images become wilder nauseatingly violent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Catherine undresses Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night, in the hidden flat that Tom kept for Myrtle, we were buoyed by a sort of chemical madness, a willingness of the heart that burst thunderously upon us all... And suddenly, I began to like New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the puppy sits on the table groaning faintly through t smoke, Myrtle suddenly springs to her feet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I've got to get a massage, and a wave, and a collar for the dog, and one of those cute little ash-trays where you touch a spring, and a wreath with a black silk bow for mother's grave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pivoting through the smoky air, Myrtle begins to strip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear I'm giving you this dress!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myrtle strips as Mrs. McKee greedily lunges for the dress

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adorable! Adorable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDEN CUT: Nick, very drunk, finds himself at the bathro window, observing the infinite life of the city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High over the city our yellow windows must have contributed their share of human secrets to the casual watcher in the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, now alone, pen in hand, writes furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I was him too, looking up and wondering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, simultaneously in the street below, can see himself upstairs looking out from Myrtle's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was within and without; enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POETIC VISUAL: The Manhattan skyline - millions of lighte windows frame silhouettes of this inexhaustible humanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY WE HEAR Tom violently yelling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got no right to speak her name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Myrtle emerge from the bedroom half-dressed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy! Daisy! Daisy! I'll speak it whenever I want! Daisy! Dai--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY! A short, sharp movement, Tom breaks Myrtle's no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick. AS MYRTLE SCREAMS, BLOOD FLIES ACROSS THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL OUT: Through the window; this drama becomes merely o more of the countless many that play out in this vast cit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's been reading to the Doctor. He sits on the couch, hand-written pages on his lap. He admits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no clue how I got home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is still asleep. Harsh morning light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: His eyelids slowly flutter awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He realizes he's been sleeping on the porch in his underw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do know that I awoke with a distinctly uneasy feeling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His pants lie next to him, his shirt is on the railing, h jacket is in a tree, and his car is parked in the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden feeling of disquiet makes Nick look up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....that Gatsby was watching me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He was watching me. In fact, I know now that Gatsby was always watching me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I got an invitation... I was the only one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE IN IMAGE: An immaculate CHAUFFEUR, in uniform of rob egg blue, stands on Nick's doorstep, holding a silver tra which rests an invitation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one, except me, every received an actual invitation to Gatsby's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words written on the invitation PUSH FORWARD: "Dear M Carraway, the honor would be entirely mine, if you would attend my little party..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of limousines stretches from the lights of Manhatt towards Gatsby's gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, the rest of New York simply came, uninvited...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an open-topped Rolls Royce motors through Gatsby's gat a roadster packed with rowdy revellers, swerves onto the verge and roars cheekily by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole city packed into automobiles and all weekend, every weekend, ended up at Gatsby's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE HIGH AND WIDE: Gatsby's magnificent castle. Illumin fountains line a driveway packed with limousines; crowds glamorous people stream up the broad marble stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in white flannels, Nick offers his invitation to doorman who shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I mean everyone: from every walk of life, from every corner of New York City, this kaleidoscopic carnival spilled through Gatsby's door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gaggle of gorgeous, but obviously low-class girls, carelessly sweep Nick through the portico and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bizarre mix of characters surge toward light at the end this dark, vaulting, vomitorium-like passageway. BANG! Do burst open; the dazzling spectacle of the Grand Ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Champagne fountains vault to the ceiling. At the base of fountains waiters scoop finger-bowl sized glasses onto tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, almost unable to believe his eyes, takes in the impossible variety of guests at Gatsby's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A caravansary of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAGES OF THE VARIOUS CHARACTERS illustrate his voice-ove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billionaire play-boy publishers, and their blond nurses... Heiresses comparing inheritances on Gatsby's beach... My boss, Walter Chase, losing money at the roulette tables... Gossip columnists... Alongside gangsters and governors exchanging telephone numbers... Silent film stars... Broadway directors... Morality protectors... Casino collectors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underage hecklers... And Ewing Klipspringer, dubious descendent of Beethoven!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overwhelmed, and out-of-place, Nick approaches the bar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) Do you know where I might find the host, Mr. Gatsby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brandishes his invitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live just next door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gatsby? I've never seen him sir. Why, no one has...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender automatically hands Nick a martini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone, and a little embarrassed, I decided to get... roaring drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He downs the martini in one gulp, steps over an even drun guest, who collapses at his feet, and makes his way out t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gazes out over the impossibly decadent party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As, unbeknownst to him, a mysterious, masked guest stalks toward him from behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I might see you here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, Nick turns to find... Jordan Baker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remembered you lived next door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its like... an amusement park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan seductively leads Nick down the terrace steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get an invitation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People aren't invited to Gatsby's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I was... I seem to be the only one. Who is this Gatsby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A haughty East Egger, TEDDY, interjects...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a German spy during the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy Barton. Nick Carraway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A German spy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy's annoying East Egger friend, NELSON, chimes in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no. He's the Kaiser's assassin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the third of the East Egger trio, LANGUID GIRL, adds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard he killed a man once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look at him sometimes when he thinks no one's watching... I'll bet he killed a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kills for fun! Free of charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he's already richer than God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns to Jordan; an alarmed whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe he killed a man do you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go find him, and you can ask him yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the dance-floor erupts, and world-famous dancer Gilda is announced, Jordan leads Nick off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC FEVERISHLY BUILDS! As Nick and Jordan bound up a winding staircase, Jordan teases seductively...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mr. Gatsby...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I lead you into his clutches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! Nick and Jordan explode into a dark room. A stout, middle-aged man wheels to them with unsettling intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't find him...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plucks two finger-bowl sized cocktails from a row line on the table and hands them to Nick and Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This house and everything in it, are all part of an elaborate disguise. But Mr. Gatsby doesn't exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phooey; I've met him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one; the Prince, the Spy, the Murderer? I've been wandering his halls drunk for about a week now - but no matter where I look, I can't find anyone who knows anything real about Mr. Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't care; he gives large parties - and I like large parties, they're so intimate; at small parties there isn't any privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly to Owl Eyes) But if that's true; what's all this for...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, my dear fellow, is the question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owl Eyes looks to the window; and Nick and Jordan follow gaze to... Gatsby's garden, where, as the band hits fever pitch, and twilight becomes night... THE PARTY HAS BEGUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the music nears its final crescendo, the evening's man fantastical characters dance uproariously around the pool

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On an elaborate flotilla in the center of it all Jordan a Nick are kicking a wild Charleston. The number finally pe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't expect all this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you expect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disappointed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the slightest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan and Nick look as if they might just kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penny-less pantywaist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy leers between them and pulls Jordan away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm stealing her away Carraway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over wild applause, the ORCHESTRA LEADER announces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, please make your way to the grand terrazzo; for the premiere of Mr. Vladimir Tostoff's "A Jazz History of the World", and accompanying fireworks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick follow Jordan, but Teddy cuts him off--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look around you! Rich girls don't marry poor boys--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On cue, a drinks tray floats into frame. There is a flurr movement... Teddy rudely snatches a couple of martinis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, disoriented and empty-handed, begins up the stairs, as he does so, hears the voice of the man holding the tra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your face is familiar. Weren't you in the Third Division during the war?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes; The Ninth Battalion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: THE MAN. He is tanned and handsome; just past thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the Seventh. I knew I'd seen you somewhere before... Having a good time, old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole thing's incredible - I live next door... (brandishing his now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He even sent me an invitation, but I still haven't met Mr. Gatsby, no one's met him; they say he's third cousin to the Kaiser and second cousin to the devil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the landing, half way up the steps, the man takes a dr from a waiter's tray and hands it to Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I'm not a very good host, old sport... I'm Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick - his face drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.. I'm very sorry-- I... I've had so much to drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The delirious opening chords of Tostoff's "History" coinc with a gorgeous explosion of fireworks in the night sky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you knew, old sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby smiles a dazzling smile; sound fades to a serene h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His smile was one of those rare smiles that you may come across four or five times in life. It seemed to understand you and believe in you just as you would like to be understood and believed in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All at once the bubble bursts, a silver-haired, fifty-ish in an immaculate tail-suit, (HERZOG) leans into Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me sir; Chicago on the wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby nods, but before he departs he smiles at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying out my new hydroplane in the morning. Want to go with me, old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick shakes himself from his reverie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time that suits you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby turns, and catches for the first time, Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovely to see you Miss Baker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her lightly on the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need anything, just ask for it, old sport. I will rejoin you later... Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick watches Gatsby walk away, he whispers with amazem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expected him to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old and fat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes; young men don't just drift coolly out of nowhere and buy a palace on Long Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me once he was an Oxford man. However, I don't believe it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I just don't believe he went there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan is interrupted by a voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Nick jump to find Herzog suddenly beside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Baker; Mr. Gatsby would like to speak to you... Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, madame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vladimir Tostoff's erotic, ominous chords build, Jorda crosses the now empty dance floor toward the silhouette o Gatsby in the library window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, unsettled, watches her go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarmingly drunk girls sprawl at the feet of the grand pi Klipspringer plays, a weeping woman attempts to slur alon and as a dejected Nick passes them toward the front stair the library door opens, and Jordan emerges alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing Nick, she rushes to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick! Nick! I've just heard the most shocking thing; it all makes sense...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy and the other East Eggers accost Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been!? The car's waiting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan is dragged out the door... Nick, on tenterhooks follows, as Jordan calls back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simply amazing! It all makes sense. It all makes sense...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night has devolved into drunken mayhem as cars jam th driveway and intoxicated guests search for their vehicles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick chases Jordan down the marble stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes sense...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything... But here I am tantalizing you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The East Eggers and Jordan pile into their limousine. Jor a mysterious smile as she leans out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I swore I wouldn't tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick. I'm sorry, I swore I wouldn't tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car takes off and Nick is left staring; mystified...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice startles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to keep her from you, old sport. Don't forget; we're going up in the hydroplane tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herzog appears behind Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philadelphia on the phone, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby nods, then smiles that intoxicating smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, old sport...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby nods warmly, and turns inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick walks away he is confronted by a bizarre scene: a crowd gathers around a COUPГ‰, resting on its side in a d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY! Owl Eyes pops from the wreck. He leers drunkenl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whazza matter!? We run outta gas!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beep of a horn catches Nick's attention. Jordan, lean out of the window of her car as it sweeps away, calls to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and see me... We'll have tea! I'm in the phone-book!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick waves, smiles, and cuts across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick. As he reaches the stone-pass separating h yard from Gatsby's, he stops; a familiar feeling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High up in the window, the shadowy figure of Gatsby stand phone pressed to his ear, watching Nick. After a moment, raises his hand in formal farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We rode in the hydroplane... And I attended two more of his parties, even made use of his beach. But I soon realized that I knew absolutely nothing about Gatsby at all, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is eating breakfast, studying bonds, when his glass orange juice begins to rattle and shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puzzled, Nick hurries to the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's yellow Duesenberg hurtles up Nick's drive and sk to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick emerges to his porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby leaps out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its pretty isn't it, old sport...? Haven't you seen it before? Its all a custom job. Supercharged engine. Get dressed... We're having lunch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duesenberg whips and winds along a tree-lined road... Gatsby, beyond nervous, drives with reckless intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... well... Ah... Look here, old sport... What's your opinion of me, anyhow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My... opinion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, your opinion!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby yanks the wheel; Nick hangs on for dear life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to get the wrong impression from all those bizarre accusations you must be hearing. A pack of lies I assure you. You've heard the stories...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you God's truth. God's truth about myself! (raises right hand) I am the son of some very wealthy people from the Middle-West; sadly, all dead now... I was brought up in America, but educated at Oxford; because all my ancestors have been educated there for many years. You see, it's a... a family tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gatsby's speech continues at breakneck speed... Nick's V.O. fades up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way he spoke... No wonder people thought he was lying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that I lived like a young Prince in all the capitals of Europe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Europe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barrelling around a blind turn, Gatsby wrenches at the wh and maniacally overtakes a truck laden with farmhands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Europe! Paris; Venice; Rome; Vienna, Zurich, Helsinki... Collecting jewels, chiefly rubies, hunting big game, painting, a little, things for myself mostly, and trying to forget something very sad that happened to me long ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN UP: The Duesenberg rockets forth; in the far distance lush green countryside cedes to the lifeless Valley of As

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby hasn't stopped for breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then came the war, old sport...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just when I thought it couldn't be any more fantastical...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a great relief and I tried very hard to die, but I seemed to bear an enchanted life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He became a war hero, single- handedly defeating the German army!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Gatsby. He speaks with sudden, subdued emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Argonne Forest I took my machine gun detachment so far forward... We were outnumbered five to one. There was a half mile gap on either side of us where the infantry couldn't advance. We stayed there two days and two nights, 130 men with only 16 Lewis guns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something catches Nick's eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK'S POV: Myrtle Wilson pumps gas outside Wilson's Gara

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...When the infantry came up at last they found the insignia of 3 German divisions among the piles of the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREEECHHH!!! Gatsby slams to halt at the train crossing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was promoted to Major and every Allied government gave me a decoration; even Montenegro! Little Montenegro down on the Adriatic Sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM! A medal is suddenly in Nick's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here! That's the one from Montenegro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks authentic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Jay Gatsby. For Valor Extraordinary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAP! A photograph joins the medal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's another thing that I always carry. A souvenir of my Oxford days; the man on my left is now the Earl of Doncaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The photograph. Young men in blazers loaf in fr of Oxford College. Gatsby stands with a cricket bat in ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could I say...? The photograph was undoubtedly authentic. Could it all be true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING! The gate lifts. And as Gatsby peels out, towards Ne York, he continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't take my word for it. At lunch, I'm going to introduce you to one of New York's most distinguished businessmen; my friend, Mr. Meyer Wolfsheim, who will confirm all I've told you, and vouch for my good character...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby weaves between the pylons of the elevated highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure that's not necessary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby wheels to Nick, smiling with charming intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh but it is though...! You see, I thought you ought to know something about my life. I... I don't want you to think I'm just some... some nobody. You see, old sport, I'm going to make a very big request of you today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big request?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes... Miss Baker will explain everything when you take her to tea this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (caught off guard) Jordan...? What's she got to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I assure you it's nothing underhand. Miss Baker's an honest sportswoman; she'd never do anything that wasn't alright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RRIIIRRRAA! A shrieking police siren! Before Gatsby can continue, a MOTORCYCLE COP pulls alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over!!! Pull over to the curb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, old sport! Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without slowing, Gatsby takes a card from his pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right you are... Know you next time, Mr. Gatsby. Excuse me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop peels off; and the Duesenberg, carrying an absolu mystified Nick, rockets towards the Queensboro Bridge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of your old Oxford pals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... actually, I was able to do the Commissioner a favor once; he sends a Christmas card every year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I imagine he'll be at lunch too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time we reached the bridge I was impossibly confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns to see: A Rolls Royce in which two stylish AFR AMERICAN MEN and a WOMAN haughtily quaff champagne. They driven by a WHITE CHAUFFEUR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An orchestral melody surges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know what to think... But the city seen from the Queensboro Bridge is always the city seen for the first time, in its first wild promise of all the mystery and the beauty in the world. Anything can happen now that we've slid over this bridge, I thought; anything at all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the orchestra builds, Gatsby's car shoots into Manhatt through Times Square and beneath the famous advertisement the man in the Arrow shirt. We follow, sweeping high over skyscrapers. The Duesenberg pulls up on the street below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY THE CAMERA PLUMMETS with startling velocity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Gatsby could happen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAAAAM! A fat beat kicks as we explode through a grate, i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sweaty grind of music shakes the air. On stage a pian THE PROFESSOR, bangs out a sizzling tune!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: Nick and Gatsby entering the cramped shop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the room a tall, distinguished, grey-bea man in an exquisitely cut suit, and with gold rings on ev finger, is having a beard trim. This, is MEYER WOLFSHEIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah my boy...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meyer, Meyer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smell so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Carraway; my friend, Mr. Wolfsheim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby guides Nick and Wolfsheim toward the back of the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wonderful pleasure, Mr. Carraway. I know all about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! Mr. Gatsby is always talking about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby raps a coded knock on a hidden door at the back of shop. The door slides open, the rumble of music pours out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, join us for a little lunch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby ushers Wolfsheim and Nick down narrow creaking sta through the crowd and into the smoke-filled speakeasy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: Nick, taking in his NEW, SEEDY surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Gatsby) Tell Walter Chase; "he shuts his mouth or he doesn't get a penny..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk about that later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HEAD WAITER appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Highballs, Mr. Gatsby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, highballs it is. (points to Nick) You take good care of my friend here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A portly man of obvious stature, surrounded by scantily c flappers, yells from a corner booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jay...! You're under arrest!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby smiles and tips his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You be careful now. You're turning into a real Jazz-Hound Commissioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that's the Commissioner back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby, the king here, greets patrons high and low...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees SENATOR GULICK at the craps table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You be careful at those tables now Senator!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! I'll put a bet on for you Jay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiters clear a front row table - best seat in the house Gatsby helps Wolfsheim to his. Wolfsheim eyes the girls o the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby flashes Nick a charming smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we order? (to the waiter) Lobster tails all round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They decorate it with truffle slices and fine herbs. Very artistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfsheim glances to Gatsby, and then turns again to Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... How is the bond business Mr. Carraway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you're looking for a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. This isn't the man. This is the friend I told you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Beg your pardon, I had a wrong man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woldsheim pats Nick on the back, unsettling him further..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby, a quick glance to his watch and Wolfsheim, jumps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if you'll excuse me. I have to make THAT call. (gesturing to Nick) Meyer, do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby leaving Nick and Wolfsheim alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby! What a gentleman! From one of the finest families in the Midwest... Sadly all dead now. Let me tell you, when I made the pleasure of Mr. Gatsby's acquaintance just after the war, I knew I had discovered a man of fine breeding. A war hero! Such... medals. And, an Oggsford man. Oggsford College in England. You know Oggsford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you would know that a man like that can be trusted. With a friend, with someone like you, he would never so much as look at your wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not... married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you work on Wall Street, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick studies Wolfsheim, noticing an oddity about his outf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at my tiepin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finest specimen of human molars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Nick can recover, Gatsby suddenly returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. Everything alright...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes... We were just talking about other people's wives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking his seat) Other people's wives? Ah... I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby looks to Wolfsheim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other people's wives... Meyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfsheim nods, smiles, and checks out the dancing girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, my work here is done. I'll leave you gentlemen to talk about your sports and your women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfsheim follows his favorite dancer off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to excuse him... In his old age, he's prone to "digress..." He's a regular around here; a real denizen of Broadway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he anyhow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meyer? He's a gambler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over Nick and Gatsby's shoulders is Wolfsheim, mingling w the ladies; but occasionally glancing in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An actor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meyer? No. He's the man who fixed the 1919 World Series.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fixed it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fixed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he manage that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just... saw the opportunity, I suppose. He's a very smart man. (tries to change subject) Now, old sport, about Miss Baker, and that request we spoke of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Gatsby can go on, Tom Buchanan looms over the tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Nick! Nick! Where've you been!? Daisy's furious you haven't called up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Gatsby stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mr. Gatsby, Mr. Buchanan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Gatsby. With strange intensity he offers his ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so very, very... delighted to make your acquaintance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom turns back to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have expected to find you in this temple of virtue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having lunch with Mr. Gats--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns, but inexplicably, Gatsby is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH TOWARD: Nick, surprise rising into anger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan is perched at an elegant table, overlooking Times Square and the advertisement of the man in the beautiful Arrow shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: Nick, frustrated, dodging the fashionable and famous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Ms. Baker. Yes. The famous sporting star. The golfer... There... I've spotted her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick comes to an abrupt halt in front of Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What game are you and Gatsby playing at!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An immaculate MAITRE'D offers Nick a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will the gentleman be joining?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment please--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Nick, sit down. This is a polite restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick's frustration and Jordan's embarrassment grow--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all very strange. He picks me up in his fancy yellow car... And he's going on and on and on about his life and the war and rubies and Oxford and... What is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll just have a seat--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this big request!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick--! He just wants you to invite Daisy to tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tea? (not what Nick expected) Daisy...? And Gatsby...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I don't know quite where to start. You see... I met Gatsby, five years ago, in Louisville...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON: Golf shoes biting into soft, green grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the day I got my new English golf shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE: A row of fancy Louisville homes - red, white and bl bunting "tut, tutting" in the breeze - are set along a beautiful, green stretch of park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy was by far the most popular girl with the Officers from Camp Taylor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the road, 18 YEAR OLD DAISY is perched in the fron seat of her flashy white roadster, beaming, happy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them was in the car with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside Daisy REVEAL: A handsome lieutenant: YOUNG JAY GAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Gatsby. And the way he looked at her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silhouettes of Jordan and Nick, leaned close, are lit magnificently against the beaded lights of the city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the way all girls want to be looked at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes meet; a conspiring flicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby leads his men on a heroic charge out of the trench

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby was sent off to war...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE EXPLOSION rocks the battlefield!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when the war ended... For some unknown reason, Gatsby couldn't return...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A year later, Tom Buchanan of Chicago swept in and stole her away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exquisite string of pearls coils around Daisy's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave her a string of pearls worth $350,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: Tom, tightening the clasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, the morning of the wedding, Daisy received a letter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the bed, Daisy, hysterical, clutches a bottle in one h and a letter in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them Daisy's changed her mind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy! Please, everyone's waiting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy reaches for the pearls around her neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give them back!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly! Daisy tears the pearls and hurls them; they exp into a hundred shimmering pieces against the hard wood fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: A set of stern, white heels clicking down the hal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: Daisy's hard-mouthed MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What on earth is going on in here!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: her mother's eyes land on the bottle, and then the letter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN: The last line of the letter reads: Love, Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan, run the bath! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bath, Daisy's grips the letter in her trembling ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was in the letter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deep breath, a last look, and then, Daisy opens her han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The letter comes to pieces like snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She wouldn't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before the letter disappears completely we read one m line: "The truth is..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy and Tom, newly married, pose for photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyways, that day, at five o'clock, Daisy Faye married Tom Buchanan with more pomp and circumstance than Louisville had ever seen...
