dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan and Nick stroll beneath the soaring electric signs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the honeymoon, I saw them in Santa Barbara. It was touching, actually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd never seen a girl so in love with her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week later, Tom crashed his car. The girl with him was a chambermaid at the Santa Barbara Hotel. It got into all the papers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jordan and Nick approach the curb, waiting for a cab, turns to Jordan; he's struck by a... sudden, puzzled thou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a strange coincidence, isn't it? Gatsby's house being just across the bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan whirls round--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no coincidence. He bought that house to be near her, he threw all those parties hoping she'd wander in one night. He constantly asked about Daisy... I was the first one who knew her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick takes this in; as if seeing Gatsby for the first tim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that for a girl he hasn't seen in five years...? And now he just wants me to have her for tea...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The modesty of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of takes your breath away, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab pulls up, and Nick opens the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan slides in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening sweethearts! Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long Island, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think I should? I mean, does Daisy want to see Gatsby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a stern whisper) She's absolutely not to know. You are just supposed to invite her over so he can "happen to drop by."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick, unsure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember feeling torn. Was it right to bring my cousin Daisy, a married woman, together with a man I hardly knew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick wonders, the taxi floats across Times Square, und the cool eyes of the man in the Arrow shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's taxi pulls past Gatsby's mansion, ablaze with ligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I returned home, Gatsby's was lit, from tower to cellar, as if for another wild party. But... There wasn't a sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick's taxi groans away, Gatsby appears striding throu the illuminated trees toward Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your place looks like the World's Fair... or Coney Island!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, does it? I've... I've just been glancing into some rooms... Let's go to Coney Island, old sport, we can take my car--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we can take a plunge in the swimming pool? I haven't made use of it all summer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must go to bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby looks crestfallen. Nick puts him out of his misery

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy to do it. Jay-- I'm going to call Daisy and invite her to tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's alright. I don't want to put you to any trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What day would suit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What day would suit you...? I don't want to put you to any trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day after tomorrow alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day after tomorrow? Well, I'd... I'd want to get the grass cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look at the grass - there is a sharp line where Nick's ragged lawn ends and Gatsby's manicured one begins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another little thing... I thought-- Look here, old sport-- You don't make much money, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll pardon my... You see, I carry on a little business on the side - a sort of sideline - you understand what I'm saying right? You're selling bonds, aren't you, old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this might interest you... It happens to be a rather confidential sort of thing... But you might pick up a nice bit of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got my hands full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't have to do any business with Wolfsheim. I assure you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no... Its a favor Jay. Just a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's sincerity disarms Gatsby; a tiny, embarrassed nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if no one has ever done him a favor before in his life

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, right, right... Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this, Gatsby turns and strolls back toward his blazi castle. Nick's gaze falls upon the unkempt lawn. He smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOP SHOT: An enormous mower clatters through frame, carvi Nick's unkempt lawn into a fresh, broad, band of green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: An army of gardnders giving Nick's lawn and garde make-over, fresh paint, new flowers, trimmed hedges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy rain now falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby, dressed in white flannel suit, silver shirt, and tie, leads a dozen umbrella-holding servants across the l Herzog holds an umbrella over Gatsby; the other servants shelter extravagant floral arrangements in crystal vases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick watches the parade through his window, opening his d just as Gatsby arrives; the servants continue inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the porch, Gatsby looks around distractedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the papers said they thought the rain would stop about four. I think it was the Journal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grass looks fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby looks at Nick without really comprehending, or see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Grass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON: A mantelpiece clock, ticking in the tense silen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER: The room is crowded with absurdly extravagant flor arrangements. Nick sits watching as Gatsby intensely pace The silence stretches, and stretches... Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got everything you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps more flowers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they did a fine job, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's too much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so too... She'll be impressed, won't she old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this, Gatsby straightens his suit, sits, and hurried checks his watch. Another long silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON: Gatsby... SUDDENLY! He leaps to his feet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait all day. I'm leaving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. It's just two minutes to four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Gatsby heads for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's coming to tea. It's too late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEEEEP! Gatsby glimpses Daisy's Rolls Royce arriving out front, and turns to Nick, flushed with fresh panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON GATSBY: Mind racing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy's chauffeur-driven Rolls pulls up in the muddy driv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick assists Daisy from the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this absolutely where you live, my dearest one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him with a mysterious smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did I have to come alone? Are you in love with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the secret of Carraway Castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your chauffeur to go far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back in an hour, Ferdie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Ferdie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy continues ahead into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hangs back and listens hopefully to Daisy's reaction discovering Gatsby. He smiles as he hears a delighted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh--! Oh, my goodness. I... I can't believe it. You-- Did you ransack a greenhouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is in love with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters, but is shocked to discover that Gatsby is no there. Daisy's merely been admiring the flower display...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNOCK. KNOCK. Someone is at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby, pale as death and soaked, glares miserably at Nic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a word, Gatsby stalks past him, into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, her back to the door, is still marvelling at the flowers. Then she turns. Sees Gatsby. A sharp intake of breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reunited lovers stand, staring at each other for a lo surreal, moment of disbelief. Gatsby, eyes locked to Dais is drowning in emotion. Daisy finally manages an artifici choking murmur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm certainly glad to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's face is flushed; the veins stand out on his neck his lips spasm in a hopeless attempt to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, he finds words...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... certainly glad to see you as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their hearts pound - the tension excruciating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EEEEKKK! The scream of a boiling kettle OFF SCREEN breaks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby reclines uncomfortably against the mantelpiece. Hi elbow rests near the mantelpiece CLOCK. Daisy sits opposi frozen on the edge of a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rattle of the tea tray as Nick enters only contribute the already unbearable tension. Gatsby manages to murmur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've met before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY the CLOCK tilts at the pressure of Gatsby's elbo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And falls! And breaks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clumsily tries to repair the clock; but drops it again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an old... clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate for small talk) Lovely though. A lovely... clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby finally manages to set the clock back on the mantl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silent beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't met for many years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an automatic reflex) Five years next November.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The precision of Gatsby's answer is acutely embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you old sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick pours; and they all sit stiffly, sipping their tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, terrible silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Nick stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need to... pop into town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Town...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The village; I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick leaves, Gatsby follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to speak to you...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wildly following Nick, Gatsby whispers miserably:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God! This is a mistake, a terrible, terrible mistake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just embarrassed, that's all... Daisy's embarrassed too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's embarrassed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as much as you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk so loud!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're acting like a little boy! You're rude. Daisy's in there all alone and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby raises his hand, looks at Nick reproachfully, and heads back into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick runs for a TREE whose leaves shield against the rain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking over my story so far, I'm reminded that for the second time that summer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE: Nick beneath the tree looks tiny, and very alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was guarding other people's secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. Nick re-enters, bedraggled, rain-soaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again I was within...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to get Gatsby and Daisy's attention, to no avail The lovers are completely and totally absorbed in each ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And without...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick bangs pots in the sink - still nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clears his throat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its... stopped raining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy turns; a radiant smile. Every vestige of embarrassm between Daisy and Gatsby is gone. Gatsby literally glows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it has...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, walks to the window and looks out across the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think of that, Daisy? Come look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy joins Gatsby and they step out onto the porch toget

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. Its my house. Just there across the bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby and Daisy's eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I have the same view from my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby turns back to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, I want you and Daisy both to see my house. I'd like to show her around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you want me to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely, old sport. Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Servants swing open ivy-covered gates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the gates brought in from a castle in Normandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: Gatsby's castle glistening in the sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Daisy. A delighted cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jay...!? Its so grand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it...! But how do you live here all alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. I keep it always full of interesting, celebrated people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daisy runs ahead, Gatsby murmurs to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My house looks well doesn't it? See how the whole front catches the light like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy yells back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on you two! I want the royal tour!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby has transformed into a good-natured show-off, hurr Nick and Daisy through a maze of fantastical gardens, pas magnificent fountains and into his castle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatbsy shows off his brand new orange-juicer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must understand, I like all things that are modern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy readies a cocktail shaker beneath the spout of the giant silver orange juice machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you press this button here, the oranges shoot through here, are crushed there... The juice of 200 oranges extracted in one hour...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby presses, the machine groans and juice splashes out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, Nick and Gatsby drunkenly drive golf balls out tow the bay. Nick films on the world's first home-camcorder..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its a remarkable little camera-- latest design.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While, nearby, a butler in a boat stands watch over a spinning gramophone and bottles of champagne...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do know, I'm a champion golfer, don't you? Here, I'll show you how its done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! Daisy cuts a marvelous swing, snapping a club in t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She falls into Gatsby arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick films...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks like she could be on the cover of Vogue, don't you think...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby and Nick trail behind Daisy, crossing the ballroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, champagne in hand, spots the soaring ballroom orga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...! Its beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its a custom Wurlitzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can anyone play it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klipspringer can. (to his footmen) Someone wake Ewing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy twirls round, overjoyed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music! And we can dance all night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ewing's a symphonic genius, he can play anything...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy runs up the stairs and calls down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I demand a Charleston!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby gazes up after Daisy, and confides in Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if in a dream) She makes it look so splendid, don't you think old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Daisy follow Gatsby into the bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby bounds ahead, starting up a spiral stair... He thr open a massive cabinet, revealing a prism of suits, dress gowns, watches and ties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a man in England who buys me clothes...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He playfully tosses Daisy a boater-hat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something for the lady...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he begins yanking down shirts and tossing them over rail to Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen anything like it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sends over a selection at the beginning of each season...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With ever-increasing enthusiasm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are silk! Linen! Indian flannel! Egyptian cotton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, intoxicated, leaps on the bed, arms outstretched..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jay... you'll ruin them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky! He's a madman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More and more and more shirts float down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rumble of distant thunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Daisy. TIME SLOWS AS shirts flutter, like giant snowflakes, down toward her. Slowly, quietly, her mirth transforms to sobs... She hides her face in shirts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby eases down the stairs and nestles beside Daisy, ta her tear-streaked face in his hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... It makes me sad, because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy glances in Nick's direction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A suspended moment; Daisy is incapable of speaking her he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five lost years struggled on Daisy's lips. But all she could manage was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... Because I've never seen such beautiful shirts before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it wasn't for the mist we could see the green light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What green light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one that burns all night at the end of your dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gatsby and Daisy stare out across the bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possibly, it had occurred to Gatsby that the colossal significance of that light had vanished forever. Now, it was once again just a green light on a dock. His count of enchanted objects had diminished by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, impelled to remind Daisy and Gatsby of his presence emerges from the shadows and descends the spiral staircas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds a photo of an elderly man in yachting costume...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this? Your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.. That's Mr. Dan Cody, old sport... He's dead now. He used to be my best friend years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy joins Nick at the bottom of the steps. In the photo with Cody, also in yachting costume, is a young Gatsby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never told me you had a pompadour... or a yacht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby hastily plucks a scrapbook from a row on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to show you something... Look, here's a lot of clippings, about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They admire a scrapbook together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved my letters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was my first photo of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daisy flips through and pulls out an old letter of her we hear her reading the letter in abstract VOICEOVER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cant lose each other and let all this glorious love end in nothing. Come home, I'll be here waiting and hoping, for every long dream of you to come true... Come home Jay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BBBRRRNNNGGG! The phone shrills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby crosses the room, snatches up the receiver, and tu away... He lowers his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I can't talk now old sport...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the timbre of Gatsby's voice darkens we PUSH CLOSER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said a small town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: Gatsby's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must know what a small town is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOOOMMM! A storming wind bangs open the French windows!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick moves to shut them, he glimpses Gatsby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's no use to us if Detroit is his idea of a small town...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby rings off abruptly, and catches Nick's eye - a ten moment - which Gatsby banishes with that electrifying smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the distant, jaunty sounds of a pipe organ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Klipspringer! He must be awake! Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, wearing a flowing robe and heels, dances a Charles with Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elaborate picnic, complete with candelabras and a moun of cushions, is laid out on the floor. There, Gatsby sits looking on, flush with joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly though, Gatsby's expression turns introspective. A watches Daisy dance, memories flood back to him...

dialogues.speaker: AN ARRAY OF MEMORIES AND IMAGES DISSOLVE ONE INTO THE OTH
dialogues.text: Gatsby and Daisy, five years ago, about to kiss; a hand- written letter; a gathering storm; the green light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of candles flicker in patterns. As a slow, melancholic waltz plays, Gatsby and Daisy dance, enraptured...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I had done everything on earth with you. All my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby holds her closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish that it could always be like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the room, Nick, exhausted and drunk and unnoticed, stands to leave. At the ballroom doors he turns back and glimpses Gatsby and Daisy, in a universe all their own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only it had been enough for Gatbsy, just to hold Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The towering doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby stands at his window, staring into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he had a grand vision for his life, and Daisy's part in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is writing at his desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't until the end of that summer, on the last night I saw Gatsby, that he told me of the life he had dreamt for himself since he was a boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stops his reading, and, very slowly, admits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see doctor... Gatsby's real name was... James Gatz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH TOWARD: A dilapidated hut, shrouded in a storm of du

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parents were dirt-poor farmers from North Dakota...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: YOUNG GATZ, barefoot, at a dusty desk, surround by tattered books, strange charts, and lists. He is practicing his signature...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he never accepted them as his parents at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Gatz turns from his writing, and looks through a ho in the roof towards the infinite heavens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his own imagination, he was... a Son of God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The little boy looks up at CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destined for future glory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silhouette of TEENAGE GATZ, now 16 years old, disappe into the hills...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chasing this destiny, a sixteen year old Gatz ran far, far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A handsome 17 year old YOUNG GATSBY, in a torn jersey and dirty canvas pants, rowing with all his might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One afternoon, off the coast of Lake Superior, he spotted a yacht in peril...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Gatsby lets the row boat drift close to a magnifice yacht. Wind is whipping whitecaps on the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rowed out and rescued the vessel, and its captain, alcoholic millionaire Dan Cody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bleary face of DAN CODY appears at the yacht's railin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whadzamatta...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cody is very drunk. Young Gatsby calls urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir! The shoal here's real bad, this wind could drag you onto it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cody waves a dismissive arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaderathinkyerdoin..., old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He collapses, dead drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN: On Young Gatsby; a plan forming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was his opportunity, and he seized it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Springing into action, he clambers onto the yacht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I decided right then and there to call myself: Jay Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Gatsby hoists the sail as the storm rages around hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sailed the yacht out of danger - and into his future...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfect sunny day. Young Gatsby and Cody are sailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby showed skill and ambition, and for five years they sailed the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was alright, old Dan, he taught me everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Gatsby, now transformed, models a suit in the mirro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How to dress, act, and speak like a gentleman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks squarely at himself, and repeats a mantra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby. Jay Gatsby. A pleasure to meet you, sir. Gatsby. Jay Gatsby. Gatsby. Jay Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Gatsby stands at the bow, as the yacht cut across t clear blue ocean... He turns to Cody and calls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks well, doesn't she...!? Old sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH AND WIDE: The yacht sails toward the golden sun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby hoped to inherit Cody's fortune... But when Cody died, Gatsby was cheated out of his inheritance by Cody's family... He'd been left with an ability to play the gentleman, but he was once again dirt poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piles and piles of New York City newspapers swirl rapidly TOWARD CAMERA, and we read their headlines:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By midsummer Gatsby was front page news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A final newspaper COVERS FRAME:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH TOWARD the paper and DISSOLVE TOWARD:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another glittering party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did the money comes from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE IN: Decadent, grotesque images of drunken revellers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what all of New York wanted to know. And it was the same question on Tom's mind when he accompanied Daisy to one of Gatsby's glittering parties...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: Gatsby leading Tom, Daisy and Nick to the top o the terrace stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a great band here. Have a look around... Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns briefly to talk to Senator Gulick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters to Daisy) A lot of these newly rich people are just filthy bootleggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Gatsby. He's a businessman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah! A businessman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He owned a lot of drug stores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby gracefully introduces Senator Gulick to the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I introduce Senator Gulick? This is Mr. Carraway and Mrs. Buchanan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delighted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mr. Buchanan... (a moment's hesitation) The polo player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking hands, nods) Always a pleasure to meet a Buchanan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby bids the Senator farewell, while Tom glowers to Da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather not be the polo player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Tom... You should be proud of your achievements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the group) May I show you around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He guides them down the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must see the faces of a lot of people you've heard of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't go around very much. I don't think I recognize a single person...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you know that lady there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby indicates a lovely, orchid of a woman: MARLENE MOO the silent film star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking Gatsby's arm) Its Marlene Moon... I adore her pictures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gatsby leads Daisy, we catch Tom repeating to Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd really rather not be the polo player...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, Daisy, Nick and Gatsby sit an elaborately conceived dinner table, watching the band...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things excite me so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby turns to Tom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we've met somewhere before, Mr. Buchanan. About a month ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right... And you were with Nick here. At the barbershop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. See... I know your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the number subsides, and the crowd applauds, Herzog appears and addresses Gatsby with whispered intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gatsby sir. Mr. Slagle is here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herzog indicates SLAGLE, a dark-suited man who stands on distant terrace with three sinister-looking 'associates'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby, so besotted with Daisy that he cannot take his ey off her, whispers fiercely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herzog silently recedes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A romantic foxtrot strikes up - Trimalchio introduces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now...! Dice, Brass Knuckles and Guitars, with: The Foxtrot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby turns to Tom, and gestures to Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Buchanan, would you mind, terribly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom does indeed look like he minds, but a group of scanti clad girls who cavort gracelessly on the other side of th garden momentarily catch his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not; I think I can keep myself amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daisy takes Gatsby's arm, she tucks a slim gold pencil into Tom's breast pocket and murmurs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case you need to take down any addresses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tom fumes, Gatsby leads Daisy out onto the dance floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH CLOSE ON: Tom, growing increasingly suspicious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daisy and Gatsby dance, Daisy murmurs thrillingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is all this made entirely from your own imagination?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... You see you were there all along, in every idea, in every decision... Of course, if anything is not to your liking, we can change it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfect. From your perfect, irresistible imagination...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Nick watch Gatsby and Daisy dance. Tom looks arou perplexed by a distant thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder where the devil he met Daisy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices Marlene Moon seductively, secretly watching hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves Nick alone. And Nick watches as Gatsby simultaneously leads Daisy from the dance floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy runs ahead, playfully hurrying past the low-hanging branches of the massive tree. She disappears inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby follows, but upon entering the secluded, starlit w sees no sign of Daisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, from out of the shadows, the sparkle of jewels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby turns, and Daisy's lips suddenly find his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, still kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is keeping watch, gazing down to his yard and the tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Tom suddenly appears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my wife...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, Nick turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... no... Not for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny. The Senator said he saw her down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom follows Nick's gaze down toward the tree...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby and Daisy continue their passionate kissing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Daisy whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I wish we could just run away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatbsy is startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run away? Darling, no. Daisy, that... that wouldn't be... respectable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is still looking to the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live near here Nick...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, an overwhelming sense of guilt, indicates vaguely i the direction of the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That so...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to live here, in this house, together. You and me... Daisy... It's time for you to tell Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick, a moment of extreme tension as he fears T will investigate further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY! Their attention is drawn to a commotion on the terrace. Glasses smash, a woman screams, and through the crowd, we see Slagle and associates causing a disturbance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a circus... Well, if you see her, I'll be looking for her. You tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hidden lovers speak in intense, hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember how much fun we used to have? Why can't we just have fun like that again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby, frustrated, is about to speak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Nick suddenly appears out of the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby and Daisy break off, startled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hello Nicky; we're having a row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy glides toward him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About things... About the future... (trying to be funny) The future of the Colored Empires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, its Tom. He's wandering around the party looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy flashes Gatsby an over-the-shoulder glance; when, suddenly, Herzog appears and murmurs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir; it's Mr. Slagle; he's quite... emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny, ruffled, moment; then Gatsby elegantly guides Dai toward Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Nick, would you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gatsby follows Herzog back toward the castle....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Daisy return to a party that has become grotesqu drunken girls haphazardly bang drums...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby disappeared to deal with a dispute of some sort. Daisy waited...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Daisy, dejected...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Gatsby was unable to return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Daisy and Nick cross the tattered, streamer-littered d floor CRANE HIGH AND FADE INTO: the library window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby sits, solemn in an armchair; with quiet unease wri in shadows across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: The ominous silhouette of Wolfsheim, pacing betwe Gatsby and the window; Herzog standing watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We catch only a fragment of the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When these hot headed types appear, I rely on you... But you were not available.. A scene was made... What's going on with you Jay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH SHOT: A sleek black limo winds quietly towards the g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE DOWN TO DISCOVER: Daisy's face through the limo win her forlorn eyes search for Gatsby behind castle walls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Nicky. Mr. Gatsby was showing us the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he certainly must have strained himself to get that menagerie together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAISY'S POV: Ignoring Tom, she looks back to the dark cas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to know who he is and what he does. And I think I'll make a point of finding out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the limo passes through the gates and disappears, Slag and associates are violently ejected by Gatsby's "guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Atop Gatsby's gate, GATSBY'S COAT OF ARMS READS "Ad Finem Fidelis" ("Faithful to the End").

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is late. Agitated and intense, Gatsby paces by the poo staring out to the green light pulsing across the bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick descends the stairs, drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well there you are...! Daisy just left... But she asked me to tell you. She had a wonderful time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby is not amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course she did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she didn't like it. She did not have a good time. I feel so far away from her now. It's hard to make her understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean about the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party!? I couldn't care less about the parties! You see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has to tell Tom that she never loved him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Then we can go back to Louisville, to her parents' house - her parents are lovely people old sport - we'll be married there... You see, Daisy and I are going to and start over, just as if it were five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't ask too much of her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask too much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby grows suddenly, strangely emotional. He turns his to Nick to compose himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon old sport. Its just.. Its so sad because its so hard to make her understand, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay... You can't repeat the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby wheels around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't repeat the past?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why of course you can. Of course you can. You'll see. I am going to fix things just the way there were before. Everything's been so... so confused since then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby looks out to the green light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talked a lot about the past... As if he wanted to recover something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could just get back to the start... If I could just get back to the start I could find it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some vision of himself that he had put into loving Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CLOUDS, AMONG THE STARS, THE IMAGE OF DAISY'S HOUS
dialogues.text: LOUISVILLE APPEARS, as if frozen in time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH TOWARD: A wide veranda, strung with banners in suppo of the American war effort, and beyond into a parlour; pr Southern girls and fresh-faced soldiers, dancing, clappin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years ago Gatsby found himself at Daisy's house by colossal accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst the many revellers, DISCOVER: Daisy, hurrying thro the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to her house first with some of the other officers from Camp Taylor... I'd never been in such a beautiful house before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy rushes up the steps, and looks back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the steps, smiling up, is: THE OBJECT OF AFFECTION, Young Gatsby in officer's uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But his uniform his the truth. That he was a penniless young man with only that grand vision of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy's Mother stops her on the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, don't scamper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's so many dashing young officers here, and from such illustrious family's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Gatbsy, watching Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew that I could climb... But I could only climb if I climbed alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against his better judgement he follows Daisy up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking to make sure no one has seen, Daisy slips quietl through a set of doors, into the conservatory... Gatsby i not far behind... A secret rendezvous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew that, that when I kissed this girl, I would... be forever wed to her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy throws herself in to Gatsby's arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About to kiss, Gatsby is struck by a sudden instinctive thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby remembers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I stopped. And I waited... I waited...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's eyes drift up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I waited for a moment longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out the dark, crystal windows, beyond the trees. to a staircase of moonlight, climbing up, up, up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew that if he kissed this girl his mind would never again be free to romp like... the mind of God... That falling in love would change his destiny... forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I just let myself go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With sudden resolve Gatsby kisses Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In ravenous embrace, they fall onto the long sofa lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blossomed for him like a flower...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: Daisy, her lips tremble, eyes wide, breath quickenin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the incarnation was complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other layers of IMAGERY IN THE CLOUDS MELT AWAY, leav Nick and Gatsby standing by the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it was a great mistake for a man like me to fall in love. A great mistake. I'm only 32... I might still be a great man if I could only forget that I once lost Daisy. But my life, old sport, my life has got to be like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws a slanting line from the lawn to the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got to keep going up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby looks to the green light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has to go to Tom and tell him she never loved him... I need to give her more time. I just need to give her more time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Nick, reassuring both of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry old sport, don't worry. I can protect her here. Good night old sport...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby heads for his castle, and turns and calls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong about the past, old sport...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's POV: The green light across the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first day of spring; out the window, birds chirp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is writing and reading aloud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There had been music from my neighbor's all summer. In his blue gardens, men and girls came and went like moths among the whisperings and the laughter and the stars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He struggles for a more poetic phrasing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter... No... No... Among the whisperings and the champagne and the stars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (that's the one) But after Tom and Daisy visit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's castle cuts a grave silhouette against a stormy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were no more parties...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His lights flicker and go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's lights went out one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the gates flashbulbs flash! Hordes of press have gathe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy visited discreetly. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the gates creak open, Daisy's limo slides up the drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The very same fame that had once been a source of satisfaction to Jay Gatsby, became... a threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the reporters crowd the limo, shouting questions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locked away deep in the castle, Gatsby and Daisy make lov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the wharf, Gatsby and Daisy look out across bay, watching as the sun slides into the horizon, and the green light pulses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Daisy. She leans to Gatsby and whispers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby hold her tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long shafts of light cut through the high, empty windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT: An OLD EUROPEAN WOMAN crosses the ballroom, te tray in hand. The room is lined with thuggish, dark-suite men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a phone conversation between Nick and Gatsby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been meaning to call you up. I'm sorry, I've been... so busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unshaven Gatsby in trousers and a black silk robe sits a large arm-chair, under a vast wall of magnificent paintings. He hunches over the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Daisy and I are very much in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you fired all your servants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy comes over sometimes in the afternoons and I wanted some people who wouldn't gossip... until we decided what we're going to do... You see these two towns are pretty close together. And it gets in the papers... You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're some people Wolfsheim wanted to do something for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herzog stands in the shadows; and the old European woman pours coffee and then recedes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference as long as they can cook and make beds...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick holds the phone close to his ear, trying to hear Gat above the din around him; his work is piled high...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby whispers into the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick... Daisy's ready. Shes ready. But there's just one thing. She's requested that you and Miss Baker be there, at lunch tomorrow, at her house... Will you come, old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy needs you. I... We need you. Will you come old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON: Nick. A decision looms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT: The imposing Buchanan mansion bakes in the sun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Tom lighting a fat Cuban from a chrome lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I read somewhere that the sun's getting hotter every year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue cigar smoke wafts over the clearing of plates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or wait a minute; it's the opposite...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stands and strolls to the open French window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is getting colder every year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy grips a wine glass in her trembling hand; her eyes terrified, perspiration forms on her upper lip. She glanc to Gatsby, who stares resolutely from across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A perspiring Nick. He glances from Daisy to Gat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tension is excruciating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the window Tom catches sight of a sailboat across the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How I'd like to be out on that bay today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Gatsby. He looks up. Beyond the sailboat, he ca see the outline of his castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right across from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby slowly stands and walks behind Daisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every night I can see that light at the end of your dock, blinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby gently moves his hand over Daisy's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, Mr. Buchanan, I wanted to be close-- Daisy and I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With sudden intensity Daisy stands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the verge of tears) It's so hot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agitated, she sweeps toward the sideboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's so confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She plucks a cigarette from a carved box, and fumbles wit the paperweight-sized lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll we do with ourselves this afternoon...? And the day after that... (she snaps it again) ...and for the next thirty years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's all go to town! Who wants to go to town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her nervous hands drop the lighter, which crashes to the mahogany floor. All but Tom recoil in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Town!? Women... They get these notions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby walks to Daisy... As Tom puffs, Gatsby retrieves t lighter in one hand, and with his other gently guides Dai trembling hand... In that moment, their eyes tenderly mee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if they are alone) You look so cool. You always look so cool, like the advertisement of the man... in Times Square...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Tom, his jaw tightening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in the cool, beautiful, shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FLOATS TOWARD TOM... He violently snuffs his cigar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had told Gatsby that she loved him - and Tom had seen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY Tom explodes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to town! I'm perfectly willing...! That's a marvelous idea! Henri! Have the car brought around immediately!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that? Can't anyone at least have a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've smoked all through lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, let's have fun. It's too hot to fuss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was your great idea Daisy. Why don't we!? We'll all go to town!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've changed my mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a dangerous intensity) You've got me all excited, and now you don't want to go? We'll get a great big room at the Plaza, a cold bucket of ice, and some whiskey... It will be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Have it your own way, Tom... Come on, Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she and Jordan rush past Tom, down the hall, Tom turns calmly to Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you join us, Mr. Gatsby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then turns and calls to Henri...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri! Get some whiskey! Two bottles, wrapped in a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Shoes shifting on gravel. Gatsby and Nick stand uncomfortably on the drive, waiting for Tom and the women

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! Tom storms out wrapping a quart bottle in a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy and Jordan follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gatsby! Would you be good enough to take my coupГ©? And I'll drive everyone else in your circus wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think there's much gas, old sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby looks to Daisy, a burning stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at the gauge) Plenty of gas. And if we run out, then we'll stop at a drug store. I hear you can buy anything at a drug store nowadays... (savagely eyes Gatsby) Isn't that right, Mr. Gatsby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of sharp tension; Daisy wrenches from Tom's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take Nick and Jordan, Tom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slips quickly into the coupГ©...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll meet you at the Plaza! I'll be the man on the corner smoking two cigarettes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's and Tom's eyes flash; a harsh, competitive glanc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom lunges into the Duesenberg, slams the gears and lurch away, leaving Gatsby, Daisy, and the coupГ© in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom throttles forward, watching Jordan and Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm pretty dumb, don't you? But I have a-- an almost second sight, sometimes, that tells me what to do. And I've made a small investigation of this fellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you found he was an Oxford man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oxford, New Mexico! He wears a pink suit for Christ's sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Tom shifts gears and the Duesenberg rockets on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH AND WIDE: The Duesenberg tears into the Valley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost out of gas Tom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCRREEECH! Tom slams the breaks and the Duesenberg slides a stop at Wilson's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson doesn't budge. He's staring with sickly eyes at th giant billboard of Dr. T. J. Eckleberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson! Wilson! What are you waiting for!? Let's have some gas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to do it myself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick. I'm all run down. I need money bad... My wife and I want to go West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife does...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom glances up to the window above the garage. Myrtle's f badly bruised, stares back. Tom clocks this, and hesitate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom was feeling the hot whips of panic. His mistress and wife, an hour ago so secure, were both slipping from his control...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got wised-up to something funny the last two days. She's goin' whether she wants to or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom isn't listening... He sees the coupe approaching at h speed, threatening to leave him in the dust!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I owe you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dollar twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue coupГ© flashes by. Tom glances back to Myrtle... then jumps into the Duesenberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can have the car! I'll send it around tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws coins into the dirt for Wilson to collect. Then floors the gas and peels out after the coupГ©!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VRRROOMM! The cars roar neck-and-neck, veering, swerving skidding PERILOUSLY close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tom and Gatsby shoot dangerous glances at one another, Daisy waves carefree back to Tom....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN UP: The cars tear over the Queensboro Bridge, toward glimmering, golden city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! CRACK! CRACK! Shards of ice spilt off from a hunk bell-boy makes ice-cubes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is large and stifling hot, it has been filled wi huge ice buckets in an attempt to cool it. Gatsby, Tom, N Daisy and Jordan are bathed in a thin sheen of perspirati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open another window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then telephone for an axe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about the heat. You make it worse by crabbing about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not let her alone, old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great expression of yours, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom turns to Gatsby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Old sport'. Where'd you pick it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now see here, Tom; if you're going to make personal remarks I won't stay here one minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's foot beats a restless tattoo; Tom eyes him sudde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gatsby, I understand you're an Oxford man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, I understand you went to Oxford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes - I went there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's laugh is incredulous and insulting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure; the man in the pink suit went to Oxford!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slow, intense) I told you I went there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you, but I'd like to know when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd like to know when....? It was in nineteen-nineteen, I only stayed five months. That's why I can't exactly call myself an Oxford man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom glances around to see if the others mirror his disbel But they are all looking at Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, it was an opportunity they gave to some of the officers who actually fought in the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to get up and slap Gatsby on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make you a drink Tom, then you won't seem so stupid to yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Tom's not done yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, I want to ask Mr. Gatsby one more question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. Please Mr. Buchanan, go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a row are you trying to cause in my house anyhow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are out in the open at last and Gatsby is content.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't causing a row; you're causing a row. Please have a little self-control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Self-control! I suppose the latest thing is to sit back and let Mr. Nobody from Nowhere make love to your wife? Well, if that's the idea you can count me out... See, nowadays people begin by sneering at family life and family institutions and next you know they'll throw everything overboard and we'll have intermarriage between black and white!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all white here, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife doesn't love you. She's never loved you. She loves me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, old sport. See, she never loved you... She only married you because I was poor and she was tired of waiting. It was a terrible, terrible mistake, but in her heart she never loved anyone but me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy and I have nothing to hide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay let's go, please...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down Daisy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Daisy, please sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's voice gropes unsuccessfully for the paternal note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's been going on? I want to hear all about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just told you what's been going on; its been going on for five years...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom turns to Daisy sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been seeing him for five years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not seeing. No, we couldn't; but both of us loved each other all that time, old sport, and you didn't know. I used to laugh sometimes, to think that you didn't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - that's all; you're crazy! I can't speak about what happened five years ago, because I didn't know Daisy then - but I'll be damned if I see how you got within a mile of her unless you brought the groceries to the back door. But all the rest of that's a god-damned lie. Daisy loved me when she married me and she loves me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom starts to make himself a drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does, though... And what's more, I love Daisy too. Once in a while I go off on a spree, but I always come back, and in my heart I love her all the time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're revolting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy's voice drops an octave lower, filling the room wit thrilling scorn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why we left Chicago...? I'm surprised they didn't treat you to the story of that little spree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby walks over and stands beside Daisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all over now. Just tell him the truth, that you never loved him; and all this... all this pain will be wiped out forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy looks at Gatsby blindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, how could I love him, possibly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never loved him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy hesitates; too late, she realizes what she is doing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never loved him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at Kapiolani?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a husky tenderness) Not that day I carried you down from the Punch Bowl to keep your shoes dry...? Daisy? Never?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice is cold, but the anger is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She trembles as she looks to Gatsby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want too much! I love you now; isn't that enough? I can't help what's past. (begins to sob) I did love him once; but I loved you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked, uncomprehending) You loved me too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even that's a lie. She didn't know you were alive. There are things between Daisy and me that you'll never know, things that neither of us can ever forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words seem to bite physically into Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to speak to Daisy alone. She's all excited now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even alone I can't say I never loved Tom. It wouldn't be true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy turns to her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if it mattered to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it matters. I'm going to take better care of you from now on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not taking care of her any more! Daisy's leaving you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with visible effort) I am, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not leaving me; and certainly not for a common swindler!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's words suddenly lean down over Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gatsby, who exactly are you anyhow? You see, I have made a small investigation into your affairs... You're one of Meyer Wolfsheim's bunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom turns to the others and speaks rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, he and this Wolfsheim bought up a lot of 'drug stores' and sold bootlegged alcohol over the counter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it, old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me `old sport!' This drug store business is just small change compared to the bonds stunt you and Wolfsheim have got going on now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well your friend Walter Chase isn't too proud to come in on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been giving that some thought. How does a reputable banker like Walter Chase find himself up to his eyeballs in debt to a little kike like Wolfsheim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called `greed,' old sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right; you've got half of Wall Street out there swilling your free booze at that fun park every weekend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised he hasn't tried to drag you in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks away sharply. Tom registers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, he has...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got nothing to do with--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your little racket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy... Can't you see who this guy is? With his house and his parties and his fancy clothes; he's just a front for Wolfsheim, a gangster, to get his claws into respectable folk like Walter...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a vicious sneer) The only respectable thing about you, old sport, is your money, that's it, and now I've just as much as you; so that means we're equal!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom smiles with smug, condescending scorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, no, we're different; I am, (gesturing at Nick and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are... (now at Daisy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we're all different from you - we were born different, it's in our blood, and nothing you do, or say, or steal or dream up, can ever change that... And a girl like Daisy will never...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby explodes with terrifying rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUT UP! SHUT UP! SHUTTT UP!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shock jolts the room. We float toward Gatsby. His rage-fi eyes stare into the void, as, with all his willpower, he restrains himself from ripping Tom apart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby looked, in that moment... as if he had "killed a man."
