dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom snorts a dismissive laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right Mr. Gatsby, show us those fine Oxford manners...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby recovers and turns to Diasy, who is trembling in t corner, on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sincerest apologies. I... I seem to have lost my temper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling for self control, Gatsby turns toward her as i Tom suddenly no longer exists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy darling... None of this has any consequence. Don't listen to him Daisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy blanches; Gatsby, now desperate, babbles incoherent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going back   to Louisville to be married. Then   we're going to live together in   our house; it's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a feeling of excruciating unease in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He began talking excitedly, denying everything... But with every word Daisy was drawing further and further into herself, until only the dead dream fought on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Tom; I can't stand this anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy is staring, terrified, courage gone; she looks to T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two start on home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Mr. Gatsby's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy is alarmed now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. He won't annoy you. I think he realizes that his little flirtation... is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy, hysterical, runs from the room; Gatsby pursues her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy and Gatsby are gone. A terrible silence fills the r Tom begins wrapping the unopened whiskey bottle in the to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want any of this? Jordan? Nick? Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want any?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I just remembered - today's my birthday. I'm thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom mutters as he pours himself a drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is staring out the window, lost in thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty - the promise of a decade of loneliness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK'S POV: To the setting sun and the Queensboro Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The formidable stroke of thirty died away, as Gatsby and Daisy drove on through the cooling twilight, towards death...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MYRTLE FLIES PAST CAMERA as Wilson drags her across the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God knows everything you've been doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbing his wife's hair he presses her face to the windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might fool me but you can't fool God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER WILSON'S SHOULDER, we see with shock, that he is loo at the eyes of Doctor T. J. Eckleberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God sees everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below the Eckleberg sign a train thunders through the lev crossing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final carriage clears to reveal Gatsby's yellow car waiting on the other side of the crossing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Myrtle seeing the yellow car; a desperate whisp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking its Tom) He's here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! Myrtle gives a sudden backhand to Wilson's face as twists from his grasp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing outside his restaurant, the owner, MICHAELIS see Myrtle rush out of the garage shouting hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, Tom, please, stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY! Myrtle appears in the headlights of Gatsby's ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: The sleeve of the pink suit and the 'Daisy' signet r as Gatsby's hand on the wheel tries to veer away...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUT the car STRIKES Myrtle!

dialogues.speaker: SLOW MOTION, TERRIBLE, NIGHTMARISH, EXPRESSIONISTIC IMAGE
dialogues.text: Glass shattering, blood splattering, Daisy screaming, Myrtle's body flying through the air, her pearls showerin the night like a thousand new stars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUMP. Her torn open body hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The giant billboard, the towering eyes of Dr. T Eckleberg, watching everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The coupe's blinding headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the coupГ© nears, Nick, Tom and Jordan see the commoti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wreck...! Good. Wilson will have a little business at last... Let's take a look..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dim garage is lit only by a swinging yellow globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson stands on the raised threshold of his office, sway and wailing a high, horrible call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O, my Ga-od! O, my Ga-od!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crush of gawking spectators speak in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: Tom pushing through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: He stops, and makes a harsh sound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MYRTLE'S BODY, wrapped in a blanket, lies on a work table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom bends over it, shocked, motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: Nick, watching Tom's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICEMAN stands next to Tom taking down names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. Sir, I'm gonna have to ask you to step away--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me...! (regains his composure) I'm fine. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long pause) No... Not really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then I have to ask you to step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ran out `inna road. Son-of-a- bitch didn't even stopus car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well-dressed African American man steps near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it! It was a yellow car; big yellow car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: Tom; a slow realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN: On Nick; a disbelieving horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greek restaurant owner MICHAELIS pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a big yellow duezy; custom job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of this conversation has reached Wilson; suddenly sighting Tom, he moves toward him with a cry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to tell me what kind of car it was! I know what kind of car it was!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, realizing the danger, moves quickly and seizes Wilso

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a soothing gruffness) Pull yourself together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson, distraught, almost collapses, but Tom holds him upright and pushes him into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sets Wilson down and whispers intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I just got here from New York. I was bringing you the coupГ©. That yellow car wasn't mine, do you hear? I haven't seen it all afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policeman follows and turns suspiciously to Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What color's your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue, a coupГ©; we've come straight from New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they just stopped...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policeman accepts, suspicious still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright... Blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the relative calm of the office, Wilson's clouded, desperate eyes look up at Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who owns the yella' car...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a tiny pause) Fella named Gatsby; he's a crook, George. Gives those parties the papers are always talking about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he was the one foolin' with Myrtle; maybe that's why he killed her...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Maybe. Guy like that, who knows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson starts sobbing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Ga-od! Oh, my Ga-od!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rests his head on Tom's shoulder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom consoles Wilson and then whispers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby. Something outta be done about a fella like that. He'll pay... Oh, he'll pay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Tom driving. He sobs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goddamn coward didn't even stop his car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan and Nick sit silently beside Tom; he turns to them triumphantly accusing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna defend him now, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coupe drifts slowly up the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk up the stone staircase, Tom disposes of the situation in a few brisk phrases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll telephone for a taxi, Nick. Come in and have some supper while you wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. I'll wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stares at Nick, absorbing his disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom snorts and goes in; Jordan puts her hand on Nick's ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't you come in, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only half past nine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think I've had enough... Of everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Jordan; she gives Nick a long, hurt look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Nick stares decisively back; after a moment he turns sharply and walks off. Dejected, Jordan sweeps inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick's feet crunch upon the white gravel of the drive, is startled by a voice from the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello old sport...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautiously, Nick approaches the hedge. The closer he gets more certain he becomes: Gatsby is hiding, just below Dai window. His pace quickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sitting here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see any trouble out on the road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble!? That woman you ran down is dead Jay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so... I told Daisy I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy? Do you hear yourself--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its better that the shock should come all at once--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you!? How could you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... Keep your voice down, old sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom was right! You're nothing but a goddamn coward!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down... There. Was. No. Point. In. Stopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO POINT!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It, it killed her instantly. I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I was there. I saw! It ripped her open!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicked, Gatsby grabs Nick, trying to explain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand-- It was... my fault. This woman just rushed out, as if she wanted to speak to us... It all happened so quickly. She-- I... tried-- to turn the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY! The CREAK of a door opening. A shaft of light..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN INTERMINABLE moment. Gatsby and Nick hold their breath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Henri goes back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick, a realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Daisy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, and very slowly, Gatsby admits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, after we left New York, she was very nervous. She thought driving would steady her. But this woman, she just rushed out at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO: We replay the violent accident, this time fully REVEALING that it was Daisy behind the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It all happened so quickly. It wasn't her fault...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my fault. I should have taken the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one must know. Promise me. No one. Promise me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay-- You shouldn't be here. You should get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby gazes back to the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. No. I'm going to wait. I'll wait all night if necessary. You see, Daisy's locked herself in her room, and she's going to turn her light off and on again if he tries to bother her about that unpleasantness this afternoon. If he tries ANY brutality whatsoever--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom won't touch her. He's not even thinking about her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't trust him, old sport. I don't trust him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick considers the light at the end of the terrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Alright... You wait here. I'll see if there's any commotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you do that for me? Thank you. Thank you, old sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick skirts the terrace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rounding the corner, Nick, unseen in the shadows, can see and Daisy sitting at one end of the vast dining table, a plate of cold chicken and two bottles of ale between them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tom speaks intently and earnestly at Daisy, his hand f gently upon hers and she nods tiredly in agreement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its going to be all right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, very slowly, Daisy lays her head on Tom's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick, shocked... angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: Nick sitting, drinking from a bottle of whiskey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a car coming up Gatsby's drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Gatsby cleaning blood from the Duesenberg's fen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick appears, coming across the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay? Everything alright...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted, Gatsby turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello, old sport. Yes, yes, everything's just fine... About four o'clock she came to the window; she stood there... Then, well, she turned out the light... So... (beckons to the car) Give me a hand will you old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have told him what I had just seen. But all I could manage was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay... You oughtta go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps Gatsby cover the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight. They'll trace your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if Nick is crazy) Go away? I can't leave now. Not tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand that a woman has been killed--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick follows him from the garage toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy's going to call in the morning. Then we'll make plans, to go away together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jay she--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensing Nick's tone, Gatsby cuts him off and banishes all doubt with intense certainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just needs time to think... (he continues, calm) She'll call. In the morning. She just needs time to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just needs to think. She's going to call in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby smiles that smile of endless possibility...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to go in but stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait up with me? The suns almost up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the night he finally told me the truth. All of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's voice echoes through the empty halls of his vast lonely mansion as he confesses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I thought for awhile I had a lot of things... But the truth is... I'm empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose that's why I make things up about myself... But I`ve wanted to tell you the whole story for a long time... You see. I grew up, terribly, terribly poor, old sport. My folks were, well--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gatbsy continues, Nick's V.O. FADES UP:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He revealed his humble beginnings, his transformative voyage with Dan Cody, the war, Oxford, and how he'd joined Wolfsheim in the business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the silvery pre-dawn, Nick and Gatsby trail slowly tow the end of the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was also that night that I became aware of Gatsby's... extraordinary gift for hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I can't describe to you how surprised I was to find out that I loved her, old sport. And that she loved me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gift that I have never found in any other person...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never realized just how extraordinary a nice girl could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And which it is not likely I shall ever find again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought out my life with Daisy in it, trying to figure out how we could marry and struggle along on so many dollars a month...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Nick is able to ask:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was in the letter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby reaches the end of the wharf and looks to the gree light across the bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth, the reason why after the war, I hadn't been able to return--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the clouds overhead, the IMAGE OF DAISY, in the bathtu with the DISSOLVING LETTER... And now, we can see what Ga wrote in that fateful, last letter: "Daisy, the truth is. I'm penniless."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked her to wait until I'd made something of myself. But-- She was young, there was so much pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The IMAGE of Daisy fades...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, I felt married to her... That was all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It had all been for her. The house the parties, everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A hand takes a revolver from a desk drawer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLOAT: Toward the window behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE the staring eyes of Doctor T. J. Eckleberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God sees everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Gatsby are finishing breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gatsby sir, excuse me, Chicago calling sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now now. Keep it open. For a personal call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A personal call? Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GARDENER comes to the foot of the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to drain the pool today, Mr. Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today. It's so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, old sport, I've never used that pool all summer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby enthusiastically heads down the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go for a swim. I'll have the phone transferred to the pool...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gatsby heads toward the pool, Nick checks his watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay, I've got to go. I have to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand... Well, I'll walk you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby leads Nick toward the side gate. At the gate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do, old sport, please do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose Daisy'll call too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose so... Well... Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick lingers... Then they shake hands and he starts away. Just before he reaches the hedge he turns back and calls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're a rotten crowd! You're worth the whole damn bunch put together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First Gatsby nods politely, and then his face breaks into that radiant and understanding smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was always glad I said that... It was the only compliment I ever paid him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Nick, tired, sick-looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That morning, Wall Street boomed, its usual golden roar... But I wasn't worth a decent stroke of work. I waited for Gatsby to call with news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby heads for the pool, ready to swim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While he waited for Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLASH! Gatsby dives gracefully into the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Gatsby from below, body gliding through clear wate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A white telephone on a ivory plinth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: Daisy, considering the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gun dangles from a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson's scarecrow shadow ripples across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's head breaks the smooth, green surface of the wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY! BRRRING!!! The phone rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby smiles and gazes across toward the green light, to Daisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL FOCUS: Atop the monumental stairs, Wilson, raises a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Gatsby - a moment of strangled, startled, wonde His lips form a final, breathless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then his face hardens as he slowly falls backwards... SPL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Placing his gun in his mouth Wilson pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SILENT IMAGE of Nick screaming into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy's hand rests on the phone... She never called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby's body descends through a cloud of blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all these years, I remember the rest of that day, and that night and the next day as an endless drill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up from the bottom of the pool we see a crowd of staring faces and the pop of flashbulbs through water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...of police and photographers and tabloid reporters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headlines were a nightmare... They pinned everything on Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The affair with Myrtle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hit and run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: Gatsby's ghostly face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there was nothing I could say except the one unutterable fact that none of it was true...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL TO REVEAL: Gatsby, immaculately attired, is laid out a silver coffin and crowded by a crush of policemen, photographers and reporters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOP SHOT: Servants carry endless luggage through the hall down the stairs, and out the front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRRIIING!!! A phone rings OFF-SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the stairs, DISCOVER: Daisy and Pammy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explains to Pammy) Daddy's taking care of his two favorite girls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for a little trip. Just you, me, and daddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom appears beside Daisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRRIIING!!! Finally, at the top of the stairs, Henri answ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buchanan residence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: Nick sits atop the deco stairs, telephone in ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby coffin is directly below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I speak to Mrs. Buchanan? It's Mr. Carraway, her cousin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame is not available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you see her, will you tell her, the funeral's tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri looks down to Tom, who shoots a "we're not here" lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but... They have gone away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone away...? Do you know when they'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I know she would want to be there. If you could just get a message to her--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no further information monsieur. Au revoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK. Henri abruptly hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...? Hello!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Buchanan family exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick slowly, bitterly hangs up the telephone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were careless people, Tom and Daisy. They smashed up things and people and then retreated back into their money and their vast carelessness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to the throng of press swarming like vultures ar Gatsby's casket. Seized by fury, he snaps and screams as advances down the stairs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET OUT! ALL OF YOU OUT! GET OUT...!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time has passed. Nick sits on the steps slouched against rail. He looks down to Gatsby's still face, sad, alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rang, I wrote, I implored...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not a single one of the sparkling hundreds who had enjoyed his hospitality all summer, attended the funeral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: Gatsby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And from Daisy, not even a flower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distraught and exhausted, Nick's eyes slowly close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was all he had; the only one who cared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is sound asleep on the couch, his typewriter and doz of type-filled pages in front of him. Clearly, he has bee writing all night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor enters. He looks tenderly to Nick, and picks u loose page from the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its winter now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city is blanketed by an unforgiving, cold grey sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Gatsby's death, New York was haunted for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER: Nick, a tumult of anger, grief and despair, wandering unshaven through a Fifth Avenue crowd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That city... My once golden... shimmering mirage, now made me sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRIFT TOWARD: Gatsby's castle, ghostly in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my last night in New York... I returned to that huge, incoherent house once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very drunk, Nick trails over broken relics of lost grande through rooms that have been stripped...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfsheim's 'associates' had cleaned the place out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL AROUND NICK: Ghostly images from Nick's memory - from those glittering parties, haunting snatches of music, laughter and conversation, imagery - mixing and FADING IN OUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He threw all those parties hoping she would wander in one night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its like an amusement park...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how do you live her all alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes it look so splendid, don't you think, old sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music! And then we can dance all night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you come old sport? We... need you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish it could always be like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick wanders out as a light rain beings to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remembered how we had all come to Gatsby's, and guessed at his corruption... While he had stood before us concealing an incorruptible dream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FINAL MEMORY: Gatsby and Daisy together on the dance- floor... Daisy leans in and whispers happily to Gatsby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its perfect... From your perfect, irresistible imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stumbles along the dock; the rain falling steadily n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon rose higher... And as I stood there, brooding on the old, unknown world, I thought of Gatsby's wonder when he first picked out the green light at the end of Daisy's dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks to the end of the dock, where he first saw Gat that warm summer night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had come such a long way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly, shimmering ghostly through the rain, Gatsby silhouette can be seen once more, gazing out across the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his dream must have seemed so close that he could hardly fail to grasp it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby turns back towards Nick, and smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did not know that it was already behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby believed in the green light, the orgastic future that year by year, recedes before us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH PAST GATSBY: Out over the water, toward the green li eternally pulsing at the end of Daisy's dock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It eluded us then, but that's no matter - tomorrow we will run faster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatsby reaches out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stretch out our arms farther... And one fine morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we PUSH PAST Gatbsy's outstretched hand, THE OPENING I RETURNS: The green light pulsing in the abstract dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's final words appear as TYPE ON THE SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly, into the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick pulls a final page from his typewriter, sets the pag top of his completed manuscript and we clearly see the ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick considers this and then handwrites:

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE THROUGH THE FINAL TITLE
dialogues.text: The green light. It pulses one last time... Then, fades t BLACK.
